Class User

java.lang.Object
User
public class User extends Object
Represents a registered system user in the e-banking application.

Each User has login credentials (username and password hash) and may be linked to a corresponding Customer profile.
A new customer profile is created before the user, then linked here. author Ilinca Rusescu

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(String username, String password, Customer customer)
      Creates a regular user linked to a Customer profile.
      Parameters:
      username - chosen username (non-blank)
      password - chosen password (â‰¥ 4 chars, will be hashed)
      customer - existing Customer to link
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails

    • User

      public User(String username, String password)
      Creates an admin account (no associated customer).
      Parameters:
      username - admin username
      password - admin password (plain text)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if username/password are invalid

    • User

      public User(String username, String passwordHash, String storedCustomerId, String role, boolean ignored)
      Constructor used exclusively when loading user data from persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      username - username
      passwordHash - already hashed password
      storedCustomerId - ID of linked customer (string)
      role - user role ("admin" / "user")
      ignored - dummy flag to differentiate constructors

    • associateCustomer

      public void associateCustomer(Customer c)
      Associates this user with a loaded Customer after data import.
      Parameters:
      c - the customer object to link

    • checkPassword

      public boolean checkPassword(String inputPassword)
      Verifies if an input password matches the stored hash.
      Parameters:
      inputPassword - plain text password
      Returns:
      true if password matches, otherwise false

    • resetPassword

      public void resetPassword(String newPassword)
      Resets the user's password without requiring the old one.

      This method is used in "Forgot Password" flow, where the user's identity is confirmed through external information (e.g., phone number).

      The provided new password is validated and then stored securely as a hashed value.

      Parameters:
      newPassword - the new password in plain text (must be at least 4 characters)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the password is invalid (null, blank or too short)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string containing user details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      summary of user information
